conclusion: Understand how position and size of shadows change when light source moves forward.
Objects are positioned on the ground with shadows A, B, C, and D cast on the ground.
Light source is initially at a certain distance from the objects.
Moving light source forward makes it closer to objects, affecting position and size of shadows.
Shadows move backward as light source moves forward, because shadows form where light cannot reach.
Size of shadows increases as light source gets closer to objects.
Shadow A will move backward and become larger.
Shadow B will move backward and become larger.
Shadow C will move backward and become larger.
Shadow D will move backward and become larger.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will all move backward and become larger.
